alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 3:13PM CDT until April 14 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Bad River near Odanah affecting Ashland County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...The river is expected to reach or be near minor flood stage. * WHERE...Bad River near Odanah. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Several Roads including Miller Road, Government Road and State Road may be flooded at this stage. Flooding of these areas is also dependent on the volume of water flowing from the White River which comes in below this gauge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to be near flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 04/23/2019. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 315 AM CDT.
